channel.title: 纽约时报热门
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: Breaking News: Naomi Osaka dropped out of the French Open one day after officials threatened to expel her from the season’s second Grand Slam tournament if she continued to refuse to attend news conferences after her matches. https://t.co/9dzlrIsSmq
Democrats prevented Texas Republicans on Sunday from passing a major bill to restrict voting. But a special session could be called to restart the process. https://t.co/gH42Z7RoBs

President Biden plans to significantly expand legal immigration and make the process easier for applicants, according to documents obtained by The New York Times. The effort would undo much of Donald Trump’s immigration legacy. https://t.co/adxNidB44N

When the FDA paused the use of Johnson & Johnson's coronavirus vaccine to explore the risk of clots, the decision stoked anger in many women — because most contraceptives available to women are much riskier, yet safer alternatives aren't available. https://t.co/tEdOL73g5X
China announced that it would allow all families to have three children, ending a two-child policy that failed to boost declining birthrates. https://t.co/h1p8pm3Z90

The Virginia Theological Seminary began giving cash payments to the descendants of Black Americans who were forced to work there during the time of slavery and Jim Crow.
The checks, about $2,100 this year, will come annually. https://t.co/BZ4UxaKYtQ
Breaking News: China announced that it would allow all families to have three children, ending a two-child policy that failed to boost declining birthrates. https://t.co/gotjGU3sh1

In Opinion
"Too many were hostile to the very idea that they should alter their behavior even in the smallest way for the sake of strangers," Margaret Renkl writes of Americans' response to the pandemic. https://t.co/iLDqyzlKF5

This classic street food, served throughout Mexico, is encountered often in open air markets, beaches and parks. The original is often made with tajín; this take uses a homemade chile-lime salt. https://t.co/KWgllHymCH
Naomi Osaka won her opening match at the #FrenchOpen, but was warned that she risked escalating penalties, including default, if she failed to fulfill her media obligations. https://t.co/qMSJrvbMYU
Breaking News: Democrats prevented Texas Republicans from passing a major bill to restrict voting. But a special session could be called to restart the process. https://t.co/oICwmK908g

In Opinion
"If the mission of these aliens calls for stealth, they seem surprisingly incompetent," Adam Frank, a professor of astrophysics, writes. https://t.co/yoYX2pwgtC
For the first time, humpback whales were heard singing in waters off New York. Listen to how they sound. https://t.co/6f2u7apxTx
A hat store in Nashville came under fire for selling “not vaccinated” Star of David patches and comparing vaccine passports to the Nazi practice of requesting “your papers." https://t.co/WaUbNCtf6X

When the FDA paused the use of Johnson & Johnson's coronavirus vaccine to explore the risk of clots, the decision stoked anger in many women — because most contraceptives available to women are much riskier, yet safer alternatives aren't available. https://t.co/bWMENjviuG

In Opinion
"They got what they wanted," former NYPD and LAPD commissioner Bill Bratton tells @MaureenDowd. "They defunded the police. What do they get? Rising crime, cops leaving in droves, difficulty recruiting." https://t.co/AKmp2yeIIQ

The tragic death of six-year-old Nahla al-Othman, who spent her final years in a camp for displaced Syrians, has drawn rare attention to the suffering of millions of children affected by the war in their home country. https://t.co/vdiH4KX7P7

Genevieve Kingston’s mother died of cancer when she was 11. But before she died, she packed presents and letters for the milestones of her daughter’s life she would miss — driver’s license, graduation and every birthday until the age of 30. https://t.co/j9C8tWdEuI https://t.co/EaPRoFeIJp

Saturday will bring New Yorkers their first shot at “the best sunset picture of the year,” known as Manhattanhenge, when the sunset aligns perfectly with the borough's street grid. https://t.co/r65D4zT19X
Gavin MacLeod, who played Murray Slaughter on “The Mary Tyler Moore Show” and Capt. Merrill Stubing on “The Love Boat,” is dead at 90. https://t.co/fvAeg7PpmZ
We have just never seen anything like this," said Sara Nelson, the international president of the Association of Flight Attendants. "We’ve never seen it so bad.” https://t.co/P3pHzlzsOD

In Opinion
@rgay writes police officers “aren’t actually being rejected; they are being asked to respect boundaries. LGBTQ officers are more than welcome to join Pride celebrations — unarmed and in civilian clothing." https://t.co/gNmlfrq6wd

Nikole Hannah-Jones, a New York Times journalist and a creator of the 1619 Project, has retained lawyers to represent her in a tenure dispute with the University of North Carolina. https://t.co/JDKfmesrQn

Faye Schulman was spared by German officers on the condition that she would photograph them. She would ultimately use those photographs against them as proof of their barbarity. She was believed to be 101 when she died in April. https://t.co/x01a12pX3X

A century ago, a prosperous Black neighborhood perished in the Tulsa Race Massacre at the hands of a white mob. Hundreds were killed. Buildings burned. Years of Black success were erased. We recreated the neighborhood in 3D to show what was lost. https://t.co/AwnX8lGwoZ https://t.co/OnS4TkdDkj
Chelsea beat Manchester City, 1-0, to win the Champions League final matching two of the richest and talented teams in England’s Premier League. #UCLFinal https://t.co/Dmfo0X12Jf

Seventeen years after the final “Friends” episode, students and educators say that the show, still seen widely in syndication around the world, is a surprisingly effective resource for learning English. https://t.co/pkMGkWOfgY

Bunny, a sheepadoodle who has more than 6 million followers on TikTok, has learned 92 words — almost as much as a human toddler. Her language acquisition has brought attention to animal cognition and the use of assistive technology. https://t.co/QuLnFuolme

In Opinion
“Covid-19 revealed how teachers — in addition to nurturing, protecting and mentoring our children — are essential to a smoothly running society,” says Colette Coleman, an ed tech strategist, in a guest essay. “It’s time to pay them accordingly.”https://t.co/TpR0fs3GfW

Genevieve Kingston’s mother died of cancer when she was 7. But before she died, she packed presents and letters for the milestones of her daughter’s life she would miss — driver’s license, graduation and every birthday until the age of 30. https://t.co/dyotF84cEV https://t.co/oKLp8uiuDG

A day after Idaho's lieutenant governor issued a ban on mask mandates while the governor was out of state, the governor repealed her ban, calling it a "irresponsible, self-serving political stunt.” https://t.co/tUeKA0NIet
This tea-time treat features a chocolate chip cake with a tender crumb and a silky mocha frosting. https://t.co/6T9mecl8je

An Indigenous community in British Columbia reported finding a mass grave with the remains of 215 children on the grounds of a former residential school, which operated from 1890 until 1978. https://t.co/oLlzzxjBN7

After four years when the National Endowment for the Arts lived under the threat of elimination, President Biden on Friday proposed a 20% increase in the budget for the agency. https://t.co/SjmgoenmLc

New stamps from Spain’s postal service that were intended to condemn racism have backfired: The stamps were issued in skin tones — the lighter the shade, the more valuable the stamp — and set off waves of criticism. https://t.co/nTy0scNN41

Genevieve Kingston’s mother died of cancer when she was 7. But before she died, she packed presents and letters for the milestones of her daughter’s life she would miss — driver’s license, graduation and every birthday until the age of 30. https://t.co/p7Xvbt2eEd https://t.co/TROYvWOo3i

President Biden’s $6 trillion budget would raise taxes on high earners and corporations to help grow the middle class and pay for his infrastructure, education and climate change proposals. https://t.co/YZ4Bjyb8gL https://t.co/wroaB8e4rk

President Biden’s $6 trillion budget would raise taxes on high earners and corporations and redistribute wealth to grow the middle class. It would also invest heavily in climate change, education and infrastructure. https://t.co/5zGILLnhzh

Vice President Kamala Harris will be the first woman to address the graduating class of the U.S. Naval Academy in its 175-year history when she delivers the commencement address later today. https://t.co/2YmIzenN40

After years of negotiation, Germany formally recognized the colonial-era mass killing of people from two ethnic groups in what is now Namibia as genocide.
It will also set up a fund of 1.1 billion euros to support projects in the affected communities. https://t.co/smVVWXJTgn

14% of Americans believe in QAnon, the false conspiracy theory spread by some supporters of Donald Trump, according to a poll released on Thursday. Among Republicans only, that number rises to roughly 25%, or one in four. https://t.co/uEmZjz8mVt

Nike ended a sponsorship deal with the Brazilian soccer player Neymar last year after he refused to cooperate with an investigation into an accusation that he had sexually assaulted a Nike employee, the company confirmed Thursday. https://t.co/JDQkAdGeAm
A broad coalition of over 150 Democrats plans to start a campaign to pressure President Biden to include a major expansion of Medicare in his infrastructure package. https://t.co/kvPOjCc2Uj
Breaking News: Hackers linked to Russian intelligence seized an email system used by a U.S. agency and then mounted attacks on groups critical of Vladimir Putin. https://t.co/u9B2Ih8lq2
Seven Tasmanian devils were born on the Australian mainland for the first time in almost 3,000 years. https://t.co/Qsvc1gz8Kv https://t.co/pyfXxnv0dM

Three police officers in Tacoma, Washington, were charged on Thursday in the 2020 killing of Manuel Ellis, a Black man who had pleaded “I can’t breathe” after they punched him, squeezed his neck, pressed on his back and placed a spit hood over his head. https://t.co/zj6FTKPgFA

Breaking News: U.S. prosecutors are said to be investigating whether several Ukrainian officials tried to meddle in the 2020 presidential election, including using Rudy Giuliani to spread their misleading claims about Joe Biden. https://t.co/ZEwhB8qlgE

Paul Ryan, the former Republican speaker of the House, is set to re-enter the political arena on Thursday night with a speech obliquely criticizing Donald Trump and warning Republicans not to move the party forward in his image. https://t.co/tlmMNxhGDT

Walter Kissinger, a successful businessman and brother to the former secretary of state, has died at 96. He shed his Bavarian accent, while Henry notably did not. Asked why he lost his, Walter told interviewers, “Because I am the Kissinger who listens.” https://t.co/RyzcbaVcSA

Protests erupted across Colombia in late April, sparking a violent response from the Colombian national police. Our visual investigations team analyzed videos that reveal their indiscriminate, and often deadly, use of force. https://t.co/ad61rx2SW7
